message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper is about algorithm selection in the context of ad-hoc information retrieval, which is a core topic in information retrieval (IR) research. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a meta-learner that predicts how to combine the methods' relevance scores, which involves machine learning techniques and could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper mentions using features that quantify axiom-related properties of the query and its top ranked documents, which could be related to natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (cs.CL) sub-categories. Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on TREC Web Track data, which involves web search and could be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category.
